Title: (Updated) Copilot Dashboard: Updated meeting metrics for Intelligent Recap
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact, Admin impact
Summary: The Copilot Dashboard now shows updated meeting metrics combining summarized and recapped activities, replacing previous calculations. These changes, rolling out from late September to December 2025, enhance visibility of Intelligent Recap usage in Teams and are reflected in both the dashboard and Advanced Insights reports.

Title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Delegate mailbox access for emails in M365 Copilot
Tags: New feature, User impact, Admin impact
Summary: Microsoft 365 Copilot will support delegate mailbox access starting late September 2025, allowing users with delegate permissions to use Copilot on those emails across multiple platforms. No permission changes are needed, the feature is on by default, and admin policies remain unchanged.
Platforms: Android, Desktop, Developer, iOS, Linux, Mac, Web

Title: Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365): Users with shared mailbox access can use Copilot for email
Tags: New feature, User impact, Admin impact
Summary: Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat will allow users with read access to shared mailboxes to use Copilot for email starting late September 2025. The feature is on by default, requires no permission changes, and is available across multiple platforms. Access is controlled by existing mailbox permissions.
Platforms: Android, Desktop, Developer, iOS, Linux, Mac, TeamsAndSurfaceDevices, Web

Title: (Updated) Microsoft Teams: Share Teams apps and agents from their profile or the Teams side panel
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact
Summary: Starting November 2025, users can share Microsoft Teams apps or agents from their profile or the side panel in Teams on desktop and web. No Microsoft 365 Copilot license is needed. The feature rolls out automatically, requiring no admin action, with user notification recommended.

Title: Microsoft 365 Copilot: Version history now available in Copilot Pages
Tags: New feature, User impact, Admin impact
Summary: Microsoft 365 Copilot Pages will add version history in October 2025, allowing users to view and restore previous page versions, including manual, Copilot, or collaborative changes. This feature is enabled by default, requires no license, and cannot be disabled by admins. No action is needed to prepare.

Title: (Updated) NEW Microsoft 365 companion apps: a suite designed to enhance productivity
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact, Admin impact
Summary: Starting late October 2025, Microsoft 365 companion apps—People, Files, and Calendar—will auto-install on Windows 11 devices with Microsoft 365 apps, integrating Copilot for contextual AI assistance. Admins can opt out via Device Configuration. Apps enhance productivity by streamlining access to contacts, files, and meetings.

Title: (Updated) Executable name update for Microsoft 365 Copilot app for Windows
Tags: Updated message, Feature update, User impact, Admin impact
Services: Microsoft 365 suite, Microsoft 365 apps, Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365)
Summary: The Microsoft 365 Copilot app for Windows will change its executable name from Webviewhost.exe to M365Copilot.exe after late October 2025. The update is automatic for Microsoft Store users with auto-updates enabled. No functionality changes occur; update dependencies if needed.

Title: Microsoft 365 Copilot: Agent Mode available in Excel Labs add-in (Frontier preview)
Tags: New feature, User impact, Admin impact
Services: Microsoft 365 for the web, Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365)
Summary: Agent Mode in Microsoft 365 Copilot for Excel, available via the Excel Labs add-in Frontier preview starting September 29, 2025, enables natural language interaction to build and edit workbooks while keeping content editable and synced. Admins must enable the add-in for user access.

Title: Microsoft Copilot Studio icon update
Summary: By October 2025, Microsoft Copilot Studio will have an updated icon across its web and Microsoft 365 Copilot interfaces. This visual change aligns with the Microsoft 365 Copilot brand, affects all users, involves no functional changes, requires no admin action, and has no compliance impact.

Title: Microsoft Outlook: Declarative Agents in Copilot Chat coming to classic Outlook for Windows
Tags: New feature, User impact, Admin impact
Summary: Declarative Agents will be added to Copilot Chat in classic Outlook for Windows starting late October 2025, enabling customizable plugins and connectors. Enabled by default for Copilot license tenants, admins can manage agents via Microsoft 365 admin center. Advanced features require admin opt-in and billing setup.

Title: Microsoft Copilot Studio: Agent ownership reassignment
Tags: New feature, User impact, Admin impact
Summary: Starting October 2025, Global and AI Administrators can reassign ownership of shared agents in Microsoft Copilot Studio and M365 Agents Toolkit to licensed users. The new owner gains full control and access; the previous owner loses all rights. Rollout occurs in two phases during October 2025.

Title: Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat: Flow Builder now included in Copilot license
Tags: New feature, User impact, Admin impact
Summary: Flow Builder, a Microsoft 365 Copilot agent for creating automation flows via natural language, is now included in the $30 Copilot license starting September 29, 2025. It requires no extra cost, is ON by default, and needs AI Step and AI Prompt connectors in DLP policies.

Title: (Updated) Microsoft Viva Connections cards in SharePoint agents
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact
Services: SharePoint Online, Microsoft Viva, Microsoft Copilot (Microsoft 365)
Summary: Microsoft decided not to proceed with adding Viva Connections cards to SharePoint agents for now. Initially planned for rollout between March and June 2025, this feature would have allowed users to interact with relevant Viva Connections cards directly within SharePoint conversations without admin action.

Title: (Updated) Standard and Priority access to Copilot capabilities
Tags: Updated message, Feature update, User impact, Admin impact
Summary: Starting early August 2025, Microsoft 365 Copilot shifts to capacity-based access for some features. Non-licensed Copilot Chat users get standard access subject to availability, while licensed users have priority. Rollout completes by late October. No admin action is needed; upgrades enable priority access.

Title: (Updated) AI actions coming to SharePoint document libraries
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact
Summary: AI file actions, currently in OneDrive, will be added to SharePoint document libraries by late 2025, allowing users with Copilot licenses to summarize, compare, and interact with files via natural language. The feature is on by default, requires no admin setup, and includes compliance and audit logging controls.

Title: (Updated) Microsoft 365 Copilot: Content Sources in Copilot Chat
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact
Summary: Microsoft 365 Copilot will let licensed users select specific content sources for Copilot Chat responses, enhancing relevance and control. The feature rolls out worldwide from late October to mid-November 2025, is enabled by default, requires no admin action, and does not affect existing policies or compliance.

Title: (Updated) Facilitator agent to be generally available in Teams meetings
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact
Summary: The Facilitator agent is now generally available for Microsoft 365 Copilot-licensed users in Teams meetings, helping organize agendas, track progress, and capture highlights in real time. It integrates with Planner, Word, Loop, and Teams Rooms, and can be enabled by users before or during meetings without requiring recording or transcription.

Title: (Updated) Microsoft Copilot dashboard (in Viva Insights): Adoption metrics for Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat
Tags: Updated message, New feature, User impact, Admin impact
Summary: Microsoft is adding M365 Copilot Chat adoption metrics to the Microsoft Copilot dashboard in Viva Insights, showing usage trends and engagement for unlicensed users. Rolling out from October to December 2025, the feature is on by default, with admin controls to disable or exclude users.
